item.title: Parents Thought Her Daughter Was To Westernized
item.description: In Warrington, England, 17-year-old Shafilea Ahmed vanished on 11 Sept 2003 after years of reported abuse and pressure around a forced marriage. Months later, her remains were found in Feb 2004 in the River Kent, Cumbria. In Aug 2012, her parents, Iftikhar and Farzana Ahmed, were convicted of her murder and jailed for life (minimum 25 years). When warning signs are visible, what does it take for a community and the system to truly step in before it’s too late?

item.title: The Most Evil Stepmother in UK’s History - Leila Borrington
item.description: In August 2021, Leila Borrington contacted emergency services, claiming her 3-year-old stepson had fallen and hit his head at her home in Nottingham, England. The story that unfolds is one of tragedy and horror.

media:content.media:title: The Most Evil Stepmother in UK’s History - Leila Borrington
media:content.media:description: In August 2021, Leila Borrington contacted emergency services, claiming her 3-year-old stepson had fallen and hit his head at her home in Nottingham, England. The story that unfolds is one of tragedy and horror.

item.title: They Found the Bodybags in Their Own SHED!
item.description: Robert Leo Marzejka suffocated, and beat to death his sister, Danielle and her boyfriend Seren Bryan in August 2018 in their mobile home. Join me in my latest True crime episode where we take a deeper look at this horrific American case . Em x

media:content.media:title: They Found the Bodybags in Their Own SHED!

item.title: She Dumped His Little Body in the Bin! | Quinton Simon
item.description: In 2022, 20-month-old Quinton Simon disappeared from his home in Savannah, Georgia. His mother, Leilani Simon, initially reported him missing, triggering a massive search. Months later, prosecutors revealed Quinton had been killed, and his body disposed of in a landfill. In 2024, Leilani was convicted of malice murder and sentenced to life in prison. The case exposed troubling signs of neglect and deception. How can warning signals be missed until it’s far too late for a child?

In 2024, Leilani was convicted of malice murder and sentenced to life in prison. The case exposed troubling signs of neglect and deception. How can warning signals be missed until it’s far too late for a child?
